text: <@U24DCSJBE> has left the channel

Hi guys, newbie here, moving over from WordPress background.  I wasn't able to find in the documentation - is it better to edit directly in one of the HubSpot themes (Vast, Clarity, etc) or to copy a theme to edit?  or is there a "child theme" capability in order to style but receive updates that may be later released?

there is no child theming capability in HubSpot.

I know that the majority of the developers that have been doing this for awhile start fresh, and use the css boilerplate(or more likely their own customized version of the css boilerplate)

<@UB3NK2G00> whether it’s better to edit one of the HubSpot themes or copy an existing theme, depends on how much of the original theme’s styles you actually want.

If you start by learning the Drag n Drop builder, you’ll get a fairly good grasp of how things are supposed to be structured in HubSpot. Then if you feel you prefer direct coding you can start building coded templates. I wouldn’t start with those however if you are new.
Thanks, Jon!
The designer certification course does a decent job of explaining drag n drop templates.
I have a custom module that is looping through list memberships --
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/FB7LYE0N8/image.png|this is the printout of the list>
I am a member of the list according to HubSpot list
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/FB7QND62X/image.png|and my contact properties>
however it isn't showing up in the hubl
Would absolutely love some docs today.  A slow Design Manager is confirming my need to lock down a solid local workflow involving modules
Odd… What have you tried? Is the person a member?
ah ^^^ nvm I see above you said you’re a member
yeah, this worked in teh content staging just fine
I pushed live and reviewed it and it isn't working, then I see i'm not on the list
I'm glad I saved my debugging in the module so I could just put that in a hidden div to see what was going on
it isn't appearing in dev info either
<@U22PJPGK0> ^^^ is there a reason this is going on?
He's on vacation can you link me to the template?

I do something very similar that’s actually just tied to the hsDebug=true in the query… pretty much universal for my dev in the DM, that way when I’m looking at HS debug info I can get all of my debug stuff at the same time
